sub_title: Surgical Robotics Executive ► Strategy & Execution | Sales & Service Management | Corporate Development | Consulting
summary:
An accomplished sales & marketing executive with a demonstrated record of exceeding quota in various global healthcare markets, including capital equipment & implantable medical devices.  Responsible for installed base of 18 orthopaedic robotic systems in Europe as a result of the distributor and direct sales teams set up in Italy, Germany, the Benelux, the UK, France, Greece and Turkey.  Recruited, trained and coached multinational sales teams, as well as clinical specialist, training and field service engineer teams.

Passionate about aligning customer needs and product solutions with corporate objectives, market access requirements and business model flexibility.  Contributed monthly utilization sales results on an innovative robotic platform double that of the US market by maintaining a steadfast commitment to customer satisfaction driven by a sense of urgency and ownership of results.

Introduced and strengthened new & older medical device brands through creative programs to exceed sales targets and exceed return-on-investment (ROI) projections.

Established and managed European logistics for a medical technology start-up demonstrating a flexible & operational mindset.  Served as primary leadership contact to provide organization, prioritization and planning for issues on quality or supply chain issues in international markets.

Foster a positive, collaborative working relationships with internal and external partners by focusing on needs and goals of all parties.

Open to permanent or temporary international assignments, including those requiring relocation.  Can travel extensively, as required.

school.name: University of South Carolina Darla Moore School of Business

education.degree_name: Master of International Business Administration - MBA

awards.title: Quality Supplier
awards.description: Quality Supplier designations are made annually to companies, which meet several standards of performance.  Under my management of the account, Businessland was recognized for the first time.

profile_positions.description:
Leading changes in business model and cultural globally to transform traditional implant organization into a profitable medical technology enterprise.  Developed, launched and managing two new business functions:  Technology (Capital) Sales & Customer Support (incl. Field Service, Factory Service, Technical Support).  

-	Achieved record sales for the company globally in the sale of the novel OMNIBotics orthopedic robotic systems, including 400% growth in the European installed base
-	Initiated the technology utilization function in 2021, which immediately impacted record usage per robotic unit globally to drive stronger continuous implant revenue streams
-	Lead a team of 13 employees (incl. 3 director-level leaders) distributed globally, as well as the continued development of the team expected to contribute >200% revenue growth in 2023
-	Member of Executive Leadership Team
-	Drive commercial & product strategy for new product introductions in technology portfolio
-	Forecast and prioritize technology installations as member of sales & operations team (S&OP)
profile_positions.title: Global Commercial Director, Technology

profile_positions.description:
Leveraging my diverse experience in medical devices & surgical robotics, I offer insights, strategies & perspectives on business modeling, sales & marketing, product development and market development to small start-ups through large corporations seeking an expert opinion on potential opportunities & pitfalls.  My strategic & operational experience in many of the product development through commercialisation processes allows me to lead required projects not just in the conceptualisation phase, but also through the implementation to ensure success.

Completed projects:
- Monogram Orthopedics:  Supporting the Executive Team during their start-up period with insights from experience with various robotic innovations currently in the market, as well as commercial models & potential partners.  Serving the CEO in the capacity of commercial leader in charge of business development.
- Corin Group:  Supporting commercial teams in the US, Europe, & the UK HQ with commercial leadership, organizational development, processes, and tools to enable their success with the OMNIBotics platform launch.
- Medacta International S.A.:  Evaluated potential innovations, incl. robotics, with executive team of a European orthopaedics company to help define its growth strategy.
- Robocath:  Defined the go-to-market strategy for European markets for an innovative French cardiovascular robotic start-up.
- Innovative Medical Products, Inc.:  Designed & lead international expansion of privately-held US enterprise focused on operating room equipment.
- THINK Surgical:  Creating corporate foundation & customer base, upon which to launch a European division of the robotics company
- Guidepoint & GLG Group:  Providing expert advice on medical robotics, European medical device markets, medical device supply chain logistics, etc.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
European sales executive leading teams responsible for robotic capital equipment sales & service, including the integration of the Mako start-up operations into the European operations of Stryker Corp.

- Drove installed base from 8 to 20+ systems in Europe as a result of recruiting, coaching and managing capital sales team in European region for Mako robotic systems, incl. indirect sales channel in Southern Europe 
- Maintained the highest regional installed base utilization (ca. 20 surgeries/mo./site) as a result of recruiting, coaching and managing Mako support teams for Europe, incl. clinical training, clinical specialist support, & field service
- Establish & support site initiation and training process for new Mako customers
- Work closely with marketing and sales chain on go-to-market strategies and manage the sales & service integration
- Develop & manage budget, sales targets, and sales incentive plans
- Work collaboratively with Product Management, Marketing, Product Development, Operations and Regulatory teams on projects in European territory
profile_positions.title: European Sales Director, Mako Robotics

profile_positions.description:
Created & managed International Department at MAKO. Responsible for the development & implementation of business strategy & budget for Europe & Latin America, inclusive sales channel, marketing, clinical education, training, service delivery, operations, logistics and regulatory. MAKO Surgical was acquired by Stryker Corp. in December 2013.

- Developed European direct & indirect channels to top growth territory worldwide in 2013
- Grew Italian market from scratch to installed base of 8 robotic systems & ca. $3.1MM in implantable device revenue, representing MAKO’s largest OUS market
- Opened German, Turkish & Greek markets with 5 installed systems & over $1.3MM implantable revenue
- Leader on European integration teams with Stryker Corp. defining 2015 channel structure
- Developed and analyzed go-to market strategy for Europe and Brazil- Developed & managed European budget to introduce Mako brand to European market, incl. selecting industry shows, product literature, customer events
- Established and locally managed European distribution & logistical operations partners
- Responsible for recruiting, coaching and managing team of sales agents, distributors and customer support technicians in Europe
profile_positions.title: International Sales & Marketing Director - Europe, Latin America

profile_positions.description:
Created & led Product Management function & department at Mako Surgical Corp.  Responsible for the product definition, development and launch of stereotactic robotic orthopaedic therapies.  Scope covers cradle-to-grave management of the robot, software, implants and instruments required by the orthopaedic surgeon.  Additionally, managed Product Management department of 2 product managers and one Technical Writer.

- Directed product launch of next generation stereotactic orthopedic robot and bone-conforming bicompartmental knee implant medical device intended to contribute over $30MM in 2009.
- Successfully launched 2 major version upgrades of robot capability & 2 implant medical devices targeting partial knee replacement.
- Planned & executed user conferences for Voice of the Customer review.
- Planned and succeeded in placement of presentation and demonstration of robotic system at major conferences in Paris (ISTA), San Francisco (AAOS) & Hong Kong (CAOS).
profile_positions.title: Sr. Product Manager, Stereotactic Robotics & Applications

profile_positions.description:
Manage a US$34M portfolio of cervical spinal implantable medical devices.  Plan, manage and execute product launches and new product development projects.  Work with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and surgeon users to determine direction of brand. Develop innovative sales programs.  Train physicians and field force personnel on implant procedures.

- Created and implemented cervical spine brand strategy to revive companies oldest product portfolio.
- Developed and executed customer retention program to win back surgeons, who stopped implanting our brand for 3 months.  Regained 63% of “lost” customers and 89% of “lost” revenue.
- Launched dynamic anterior cervical plate, increasing unit sales five-fold in the dynamic segment.
- Developed & administered company’s first two sales rep incentive programs.  Programs had ROIs above 650% individually.
- Managed quality field actions in field to over 300 surgeons with no notable revenue decline.
- Created and delivered sales training content to field sales team.
profile_positions.title: Brand Marketing Manager, Cervical Spine

profile_positions.description:
Planned and executed launch strategies for cardiac rhythm management products.  Created market awareness and technical marketing programs to drive product adoption.  Managed two pan-European teams to launch tactical marketing programs and sales force efficiency tools.

- Developed market entry and launch strategy for MRI-safe pacemaker in Western Europe.
- Launched service solutions strategy in Western Europe sales & marketing organizations.  
- Planned and implemented European entry strategy for Patient Management products, including co-developing and managing European clinical study for an internet-based patient monitoring system.
- Established & tracked sales metrics to strengthened tactical marketing focus & grow revenue 34% (11% over market rate).
- Led global supply chain project team to correct disruptions for product line – reduced product backorders over 60%.
- Built physician advisory board of 16 European & Middle Eastern cardiologists and cardiac surgeons, which resulted in one pending patent submission.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
Proposed new business solutions utilizing current technology and convinced prospective customers to set up trials for review.  Engaged telecommunication service providers to understand their current and future business needs.

- Set up a US$ 25 million cooperative project between three major British companies to trial a wireless internet access project.
- Won company award for soliciting most sales leads at CeBIT (largest hi-tech trade fair in Europe).
profile_positions.title: Market Development (EMEA)

profile_positions.description:
Managed the Global Account program, including incentive planning, account targeting and planning. Led a team of 16 Global Account Team Leaders.

- Developed and executed global account strategy with sales managers in our 16 European distributors leading to  US $170M revenue in 1999 – 33% of company total revenues.
- Consulted CEO on merger activities with Infonet Services Corporation, including implementation of business plan and redundancy exercise, which exceeded cost cutting goals by over 10%.
- Created a new department focused upon business planning, as well as providing sales analysis and business intelligence to executive and senior management.
- Innovated target marketing sales strategy and managed its implementation - target group contributed 53% of 1998 revenues - ca. US $250M.
- Created sales funnel to enhance sales performance tracking and improve resource allocation based upon minimizing the cost of sales.  Achieved cost savings of 30%.
profile_positions.title: Manager, Global Account Management

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for implementing the operational partnership with AT&T-Unisource Communication Services in sales and marketing processes. Designed and implemented process quality initiatives in the sales and sales support departments. Transferred to shareholder (AT&T-Unisource) in October 1997.

- Established the sales and bid management processes and monitored the efficiency of the processes, resulting in 14% time reduction in bid development.
- Provided English language support to the sales & marketing division resulting in English language advertising campaign for the 1997 CeBIT Trade Show.
profile_positions.title: Process Quality Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Introduced new sales force discipline and tools to innovate typical pharmaceutical sales approach, which included planning and executing a sales force automation rollout to over 250 sales representatives.  Additionally, provided strategic analysis to Finance Director during the merger process with Pharmacia.

- Developed and implemented a micro-marketing strategy employed directly in sales regions, which resulted in 56% revenue improvement with approximately 15% less costs.
- Led project team of 12 members to reengineer the expense reporting process.  Recommended a solution with a three-month payback period and an annual savings on operating costs of US$170K.
profile_positions.title: Market Research Project Manager
